business.headline: Health insurance: 4 tips to reduce premiums for senior citizens Purchasing a health insurance policy at a younger age can help in securing reduced premium rates. Generally, lower insurance premiums are offered to younger people as they are considered low risk.

Index Funds vs. ETFs: 5 key things every investor should know Exchange-Traded Funds are traded like shares on the stock market and can be sold or purchased at existing market prices during the day, while Index Funds are traded only once at the closure of the share market.

ICMAI demands 'accountant' status for cost accountants in new Income Tax BillIn its memorandum, ICMAI highlighted the extensive training of Cost and Management Accountants (CMAs), which includes expertise in taxation, finance, auditing, corporate laws, and strategic risk management.

New tax regime: 3 deductions that can help taxpayers maximise savings  Though the new regime offered concessional tax rates, it reduced several popular deductions and exemptions, like HRA, LTA, interest on home loans, Section 80C, and more.

AI to take centre stage at the 3rd Digital News Publishers Association ConclaveThrough various keynote sessions, panel discussions and expert presentations, this year's DNPA Conclave aims to decode various critical issues, future strategies, opportunities and models that can power an equitable, inclusive and sustainable digital media ecosystem in an era of rapid technological advancement.
AMFI launches Chhoti SIP, Tarun Yojana, and MITRA. All you need to knowThe latest initiative by AMFI reinforces its goal of making mutual fund investments accessible to all investors across India.

Sensex, Nifty end lower for another session; auto stocks tumbleThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 424.90 points to 75,311.06 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 117.25 points to settle at 22,795.90.

Explained: What are 'high-conviction stocks' and why investors should track themHigh-conviction stocks are shares that investors, analysts, or fund managers strongly believe will deliver higher-than-average returns.

8th Pay Commission: When will it be formed? A look at the past trendsA Pay Commission recommends changes to the salary structure, allowances and benefits to be offered to employees depending upon the prevailing economic structure.

Explained: Why M&M share price tumbled 6% todayThe stock tumbled after the company said it will put money into a rights issue for its two subsidiaries—Mahindra & Mahindra Financial Services (MMFSL) and Mahindra Lifespace Developers (MLDL).

Worried about volatile stock market? Check these 10 potential multibagger stocksThe most important factor for determining multibagger stocks is to check earnings and growth potential. Investors should seek stocks that consistently deliver revenue and profit, check metrics like PE ratio and dividend yield, and compare their performance with sectoral or broader market trends.

Planning to start SIP? 2 reasons why you should consider NPSBy investing in NPS, individuals can claim tax benefits of up to Rs 1.5 lakh under Section 80C and an additional Rs 50,000 under Section 80CCD (1B).

entertainment.headline: Rapper Diddy's attorney withdraws from case: Under no circumstances can I continueAnthony Ricco, representing Sean 'Diddy' Combs, has filed to withdraw from the federal case citing reasons protected by attorney-client privilege.

Buried Hearts review: Park Hyung-sik commands attention in his darkest roleReleased-Sat Feb 22, 2025The Korean drama Buried Hearts will captivate viewers with its blend of intense emotions and high-stakes drama. The series, featuring Park Hyung-sik, explores the complex dynamics of corporate intrigue and personal survival. Read the full review.

Rakhi Sawant reacts to summons: I'm poor, not criminal - focus on rape casesRakhi Sawant was summoned by the Maharashtra cyber cell to record her statement regarding YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia's controversial remarks on Samay Raina's show, 'India's Got Latent'. She urged the police to focus on solving pending rape cases instead of treating her like a criminal.

Zero Day: Critics praise Robert De Niro, criticise show's 'incoherent politics'Critics have mixed reactions to Robert De Niro's latest Netflix series, Zero Day. While many have praised De Niro, a section of them are unhappy with the narrative of the show.

Grammy-nominated band OneRepublic unites with Karan Aujla for new song Tell MeGlobal pop-rock sensation OneRepublic is collaborating with Punjabi artist Karan Aujla for a new track titled Tell Me. It will release on February 27.

Mismatched actor Prajakta Koli to marry boyfriend on February 25: ReportActor Prajakta Koli is set to marry her boyfriend Vrishank Khanal on February 25. Their wedding festivities will begin on February 23.

Crime Beat review: Rahul Bhat, Saqib Saleem's crime drama gets lost in its own chaosReleased-Fri Feb 21, 2025'Crime Beat', a political thriller, premiered on Zee5 on February 21. Based on the book titled 'The Price You Pay', the show falls short due to outdated tropes and exaggerated clichés.

Honey Singh says he's a great cook, reveals his favourite dishRapper and music producer Yo Yo Honey Singh opens up about his favourite cuisine, his cooking skills and more in an exclusive interaction with us.

From heartfelt to hilarious, in praise of Park Bo-young's versatilityKorean star Park Bo-young has been acting for almost two decades now. Her ability to completely inhabit the skin of her characters makes her truly stand out. She is currently seen in Melo Movie, which is streaming on Netflix.

Honey Singh on his Mumbai concert: Doing something I've never done beforeRapper Honey Singh is starting his countrywide tour from Mumbai on Saturday. In an exclusive interview with us, the singer talked about the gig and what he's doing differently this time at 'Millionaire India Tour at Stage Aajtak'.

Kangana Ranaut's Emergency to premiere on Netflix. Check release dateKangana Ranaut's film, Emergency, is going to hit the screens next month. The actor shared a quick announcement in her Instagram stories on Friday.

Robin Tunney marks 10 years since The Mentalist finale, thanks fan for their loveActor Robin Tunney celebrated the 10th anniversary of The Mentalist finale, expressing gratitude to fans for their unwavering support. She also reflected on the show's impact on her life and career.

general news.headline: Trump weighs in again on USAID handout to India, BJP gets bragging rightsUS President Donald Trump's latest salvo comes after a report claimed the $21 million grant was sanctioned in 2022 for Bangladesh, and not India.

Kamal Haasan's 'don't play' warning amid Centre-Tamil Nadu's language rowActor-turned-politician Kamal Haasan has highlighted the importance of language among Tamilians and warned against taking such matters lightly amid the ongoing tussle between the Centre and Tamil Nadu over NEP's three-language policy implementation in the state.

Bengaluru woman lured to hotel by 'friend', gangraped on terrace; 3 arrestedA woman was allegedly gangraped by four men at a hotel in Bengaluru's Koramangala area, who lured her under the pretence of being old acquaintances.

Trump fires top military general, 2nd Black man to hold post, in diversity purgeUS President Donald Trump announced that five other high-level positions in the US military would also be replaced in the coming days, marking an unprecedented rejig of the leadership.

China discovers new bat coronavirus capable of infecting humansThe study on the new virus was carried out by leading Chinese virologist Shi Zhengli, who is also known as the "batwoman" as a result of her extensive research on bat coronaviruses, at the Guangzhou Laboratory.

Trump lashes out at Zelenskyy over Ukraine war: He has no cards, I've had itEarlier this week, Donald Trump called Volodymyr Zelenskyy a "dictator", while warning the latter to move quickly to secure peace with Russia or risk losing his country as the war between the two nations continues to rage.

Indore men took girlfriends to Kumbh with stolen money, arrested after returningAt least 15 cases of theft were registered against the two accused. The police launched a probe after four houses were robbed in Indore's Dwarkapuri area.

US woman 'unknowingly' becomes couple's surrogate, sues IVF clinic for mix-upKrystena Murray, 38, discovered that her boy was not biologically related to her after an at-home DNA test. When she notified the fertility clinic about the mix-up, they informed the child's parents, and they in turn sued Murray to obtain custody of their son.

Chhaava's war scenes: Spectacle without soulChhaava, led by Vicky Kaushal, delivers relentless, violent war sequences but lacks emotional depth, making battles exhausting rather than engaging. Unlike Bajirao Mastani and Jodhaa Akbar, which balanced spectacle with storytelling, Chhaava overwhelms with its brutal scenes.

LPU's 2025 Batch Final Year Student Bags Rs 1.03 Crore ($1,18,000) Placement Package-Betireddy Naga Vamsi Reddy B. Tech student has secured a 1.03 Crore ($1,18,000) package with an AI robotics company and is set to graduate in May 2025. 

-Over 1,700 students have received packages ranging from Rs 10 LPA – Rs 1 Crore per annum 

-1,912 students received multiple job offers while Adireddy Vasu, secured 7 job offers, setting a rare and impressive record.

Is playing IPL at 43 tough? MS Dhoni says 6-8 months of hard work is a mustMS Dhoni said playing in the IPL at 43 requires months of hard work to match younger players, but his love for the game keeps him going. Quashing retirement rumours, he confirmed his commitment to Chennai Super Kings for IPL 2025, where he will feature as an uncapped player.

Rajasthan minister's 'dadi' jibe at Indira Gandhi sparks uproar in assemblyThe Rajasthan Assembly suspended six Congress MLAs, including state party chief Govind Singh Dotasra, after protests over a minister's remark on Indira Gandhi. Former CM Ashok Gehlot condemned the move, calling it an attempt to suppress opposition.

Chhaava box office Day 8: Film needs Rs 2 crore to beat Uri's lifetime collectionVicky Kaushal's film Chhaava continues its impressive box office run, crossing the Rs 240 crore mark in just eight days. It is poised to surpass Uri: The Surgical Strike's lifetime collection, to become Vicky Kaushal's highest-grossing film ever.

Why is #BoycottOYO trending on X?#BoycottOYO made it to the top of trending lists after the half-page ad, which featured the line "Bhagwan har jagah hai aur OYO bhi (God is everywhere, and so is OYO)," was accused of allegedly hurting religious sentiments.

Aviation body revises pilot duty norms: More rest hours, fewer night landingsThe Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) also informed Justice Tara Vitasta Ganju that the remaining revised regulations would be implemented from November 1.

Kash Patel sworn in as FBI director, takes oath on Bhagavad Gita Kash Patel was sworn in as FBI director on Saturday, taking the oath on the Bhagavad Gita. His appointment, confirmed by a 51-49 Senate vote, has drawn praise from former President Donald Trump but raised concerns among Democrats about the agency's independence.
IIT-Madras developing metal foam to protect Bharatiya Space StationThe team has developed a Microgravity Drop Tower — the fourth largest globally — to study materials under zero-gravity conditions.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Operation Dunki: How Punjab's human smuggling rackets fuel illegal immigration As planeloads of Indian deportees arrived at Amritsar airport in Punjab, Indian Today's Special Investigation Team travelled to the key immigration hub of Jalandhar to expose a thriving human smuggling racket.

Ukraine may lose Starlink access after turning down US minerals deal: ReportUkraine's continued access to SpaceX-owned Starlink was brought up in discussions between US and Ukrainian officials after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy turned down an initial proposal from US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent.

Israel to receive 6 hostages from Gaza in exchange for 602 Palestinian prisonersThe six are the last living hostages from a group of 33 due to be freed in the first stage of the ceasefire deal agreed last month between Israel and Hamas.

Don't take me lightly: Eknath Shinde amid rift rumours with Devendra FadnavisEknath Shinde, who has been skipping meetings called by Devendra Fadnavis, asserted that he overturned the incumbent government when he was taken lightly in 2022.

Salman Rushdie attacker found guilty of attempted murder and assaultHadi Matar was found guilty of attempting to murder Salman Rushdie in a 2022 onstage stabbing. Rushdie suffered severe injuries, including blindness in one eye. Matar also faces federal terrorism charges in a separate trial.

sports.headline: India vs Pakistan: Will Varun Chakravarthy get a chance to heal old wounds?India and Pakistan are set to clash in the Champions Trophy 2025 on Sunday, February 23, in Dubai. Steve Smith surprised by question at press conferenceChampions Trophy 2025: Australia captain Steve Smith backed Babar Azam to overcome his poor form but avoided giving direct advice, acknowledging that all players go through tough phases. education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
